Review: a wim wenders doc about contemporary art, war and poetry shot in 6k 3-D. what else can i say. it’s a beautiful look into one artist’s creative process. a very serene and thought provoking film.

a brief but gorgeous log into one man’s loneliness and the ghosts that linger from it. all of us strangers is tender and chilling. a very hypnotic journey. i love the worlds andrew haigh creates in his films and strangers fits perfectly within haigh’s filmography. the spontaneous love spell mixed with an ice cold ghost story was a perfect first watch of 2024.
watching this on christmas hits different. love this movie.

an extremely visceral and raw family portrait that is deeply inspiring as it is devastating. amazing performances from the entire cast. very involved cinematography that left my jaw on the floor. the iron claw is not only an amazing sports film but an amazing film in general.
a sharp mix of humor and heart. the dialogue flows like lyrics against the jazzy score. very cool characters that have tons of personality. this is a really smart film.

i wish more movies were this strange, hilarious, beautiful and horny. every character is immensely funny and i really enjoyed the performances from the entire cast. the world this film takes place in is unbelievable! i was having an amazing time looking at it.

an interesting narrative journey through the dark parts of our galaxy and beyond. the visuals are amazing in VR and it makes you feel like you are floating with the stars. i enjoyed the musical aspect of it as well. very cool experience.

the boy and the heron is another miyazaki classic. it’s visually incredible and takes you on a very personal story much like spirited away. i loved the character design in this. there are so many creatures introduced and to see them flowing on screen and interacting with each other in each frame brings so life to the film. there was a touch of sci-fi towards the end that i thought was illustrated beautifully. i need to see this one again!

i’m not sure what the meaning of this film is. i wanted to like it but left underwhelmed and confused. the first act was really funny and interesting but i struggled to stay interested for the remainder of the film. seems like a movie that i need to watch again.

saltburn is so visually beautiful that it made me down for whatever it had in store. it has amazing style and atmosphere. i thought the main characters had interesting personalities and most of them had a good sense of humor. i wish the film pushed the edge more when it came to the “shocking” elements instead it leave more to the imagination. the journey from real life into a gorgeous hellscape is worth every second in saltburn.

killers of the flower moon is a story of suffering on all levels. there are brief moments of hope but it takes a lot of look through everything lost. As someone who lives with type one diabetes the scenes of molly being killed were heartbreaking to me. the fear she felt about taking insulin was far too familiar and the fact that she could feel it poisoning her made me feel sick. such strong performances from the entire cast. so…
watching this on christmas hits different. love this movie.
